page.title: 19SCHOOL SURVEY
page.content: A survey was carried out among all 139 children at St. Peter's school.The main results are on page 20. The results show that most children come from fairly affluent homes.This is not surprising as the school is private and the parents pay for the education (average cost Â£2700 for a boarding pupil, Â£2000 for a daypupil per year) School meals are cooked on the premises and two cooks are employed. The school also employs 11 teaching staff , a bursar, a matron , 5 domestic staff and the headmaster's wife. The children generally enjoy school and the varied activities that take place at St. Peter's.
